venn.graph
Class PlotPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  venn.graph.PlotPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
HistErrPanel, HistPanel
public abstract class PlotPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

This abstract class extends JPanel and provides methods to display a plot of data points, a histogram, etc. The subclass will provide the overriding methods to draw the actual plot within a frame.
For this class, the words
frame, title, label, scale
are used in variable and method names, and comments and are defined as follows:

frame - The border line box drawn around the plot.
title - A text title drawn along the top of the frame.
label - Text along the horizontal axis of the plot.
scale - The numbers drawn along each axes.

This class only provides for the display of scales along the left side vertical and bottom horizontal axes. A label is provided for the bottom horizontal axis but not for the vertical axis.
The size and position of the frame, title, etc. within the panel is fixed by a group of constants, each of which specifies what fraction of the panel's dimensions a given element can use.
Note that in the comments, "data" refers to what is being plotted and "pixels" refers to the drawing coordinates and dimensions.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

getPositions

public void getPositions()
Determine the positions of the title, label and scales relative to the frame.
Use 60% of vertical space for the graph,
" 15% " " " " top title area
" 25% " " " " bot scale & label area
Use 75% of horizonal space for the graph,
" 18% " " " " vertical scale values
" 5% " " " " right margin

                           java.awt.Color fill,
                           java.awt.Color numbers,
                           java.awt.Color title,
                           java.awt.Color background)
The user can assign different colors for the frame elements.

Parameters:
line - color of frame line.
fill - color of frame background
title - color for the title above the frame
background - the color outside of the plot frame.

paintComponent

public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
This method draws the frame, title, and the horizontal axis label. It then invokes paintContents(), which the subclass overrides to draw inside the frame. The paintConents() method is also responsible for invoking drawAxesNumbers() to draw the axes scale numbers.
The method first draws the panel and then invokes getPositions() to obtain the coordinates for the frame, the title, labels, etc. It then draws the title and x axis label using the drawText() method and then draws the frame with paintFrame(). At the end it invokes the paintContents () method.

Overrides:
paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

public void paintFrame(java.awt.Graphics g)
Draw the plot frame.
